Subjects: chronicles, verse in; prologues, to prose texts
_description: Prologue to Volume II of Fabyan’s Chronicle, in praise of London and its officers, Part VII, cap. 246 — twelve 8-line stanzas, aaabcccb, and two 8-line stanzas, ababbcbc

BLCottNeroCXI.First Lines: Now wold I ffaynIn wordis playn…
BLCottNeroCXI.Last Lines:
…This Cyte to prayse in eche degreAs yt shuld duely aske of
                    Ryght

HarEng766.First Lines:
Now wold I ffayneIn wordis playneSoom honour sayneAnd
                    bryng to meynd…
HarEng766.Last Lines:
…And to Contynewe the old ffameThe Kyngis Chambre þat
                    þe right nameLondon to kepe without blameAs it hath hither
                    till
